body:
It's not quite clear what you're asking. Are you able to share with us the code that you are running? What value are you finding is being computed by or returned to your code, and what value would you rather be computed by or returned to your code?

Also with what programming language(s) are you working with Protocol Buffers and gRPC?

sorry for that.  i will try to make it clearer.  

I have a Python server A (Algorithm), and Nodejs server B (Server of the App) need to request to A for a response.  
B's request data like `{"text": "xxxxx", "userinfo": {"userid":"123", "username":"ccc",...}}`, and  
A's response data like `[{"noun":"string", "adj":"string", "location":[int, int], ...}, {...}, ...]`.  

I used zerorpc before, and now want to change it to grpc:) . 

At first my solution is to define all my data structure with `.proto`, but i found it a little redundant.   
The reason is the function of A deal with the request data as a total (that is the function deal with "userinfo" as a dict, it does not need to know the details of the dict).  

So i want to know whether there is a data type can make all given data together, i know it may not a good way, but it's convenient. Then i used `json.dumps` to make **"userinfo" and the response data** to a string respectively, and when i need to use them, i use `json.loads` to recover the information.  
It seems somewhat weird...

This is my question, i am quite not sure that was a good solution or not ...  

btw, thanks a lot for your replay.

I'm still very unclear on the particulars of your problem - are you able to share with us your `.proto` content (all of it) and your `.py` and `.js` content? I think it would really help to see in your `.proto` files what messages and services you have defined.

Thanks. That code looks like it works - does it work? If so, what's the problem? Is it that you'd like not to have to do the JSON serialization on both sides?

Have you looked at defining in your .proto other kinds of messages and using them as submessages of your `Input` message?

it works.
the problem is what you said.
and with your opinion i am now sure about it.
thanks ~
